name: ABV Mail
description: ABV Mail, also known as ABV Pochta, is a Bulgarian web-based email service that offers free email accounts to users.

name: AOL Mail
description: AOL Mail (stylized as Aol Mail.) is a free web-based email service provided by AOL, a division of Yahoo!

name: AT&T
description: AT&T Inc.

name: Bell Internet
description: Bell Internet, originally and frequently still called Sympatico, is the residential Internet service provider (ISP) division of BCE Inc.

name: Brasil Online
description:
Brasil Online (BOL) is an Internet portal that provides email hosting and free email services UOL.


== History ==
In April 1996, BOL was launched in Brazil by Grupo Abril, one of the largest Communication Holdings in Brazil.

name: Cox Communications
description: Cox Communications, Inc.

name: EarthLink
description: EarthLink is an American Internet service provider.It went public on NASDAQ in January 1997.

name: Fastmail
description: Fastmail is an email hosting company based in Melbourne, Australia.

name: Gmail
description: Gmail is a free email service provided by Google.

name: GMX Mail
description: GMX Mail is a free advertising-supported email service provided by GMX (Global Mail eXchange, in Germany: Global Message eXchange).

name: Hey (email service)
description: HEY is a premium email service launched by Basecamp in June 2020.

name: iCloud
description: iCloud is a cloud service developed by Apple Inc.

name: Iliad SA
description: Iliad S.A. is a French telecommunications company.

name: Inbox.lv
description: Inbox.lv is a versatile Latvian email service provider offering secure and user-friendly email solutions.

name: Interia
description: Interia, formerly Interia.pl, is a large Polish web portal and online news platform launched in 2000 in Kraków, Poland. It is the 4th largest online news source in the country.

name: Internet Group
description: Internet Group do Brasil (iG) is a Brazilian Internet service provider that owns and operates web portals and provides a variety of services, including news, shopping and stock information.

name: Juno Online Services
description: Juno Online Services, also called simply Juno, is an Internet service provider based in the United States.

name: Kolab Now
description: Kolab Now is a web-based email and groupware service, based completely on free and open-source software.

name: KPN
description: KPN (in full Koninklijke KPN N.V., also Royal KPN N.V.) is a Dutch telecommunications company.

name: La Poste (France)
description: La Poste is a postal service company in France, operating in Metropolitan France, the five French overseas departments and regions and the overseas collectivity of Saint Pierre and Miquelon.

name: Libero (web portal)
description: Libero (English: "Free") is an Italian web portal owned by Italiaonline and founded by Infostrada in 1994 as a website to assist users in browsing the Internet, which at the time still had a fee, and in configuring an e-mail.

name: Lumen Technologies
description: Lumen Technologies, Inc.

name: Lycos
description: Lycos, Inc., is a web search engine and web portal established in 1994, spun out of Carnegie Mellon University.

name: Mail.com
description: mail.com is a web portal and web-based email service provider owned by the internet company 1&1 Mail & Media Inc., headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States.

name: mail.de
description: Mail.de offers secure and reliable email services with advanced privacy protection features.

name: Mailbox.org
description: mailbox.org is an encrypted email service provider based in Germany.

name: Mailfence
description: Mailfence is a secure and encrypted email service that offers OpenPGP based end-to-end encryption and digital signatures.

name: Naver
description: Naver is a popular South Korean online platform offering search engine services, news, and more.

name: NetEase
description: NetEase is a leading Chinese technology company specializing in online services, including gaming, e-commerce, and music streaming.

name: Onet.pl
description: Onet.pl is the largest Polish-language web portal and online news platform.

name: Optimum (cable brand)
description: Optimum is an American telecommunications brand owned and operated by Altice USA. It is the fourth largest cable provider in the United States and a Fortune 500 company.

name: Optus
description: Singtel Optus Pty Limited (commonly referred to as Optus) is an Australian telecommunications company headquartered in Macquarie Park, a suburb in the Northern Sydney region of Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.

name: Orange S.A.
description: Orange S.A. (French pronunciation: [ɔʁɑ̃ʒ ɛs ɑ]), formerly France Télécom S.A. (stylized as france telecom) is a French multinational telecommunications corporation.

name: Outlook.com
description: Outlook.com, formerly Hotmail, is a free personal email service offered by Microsoft.

name: Posteo
description: Posteo is an email service provider based in Berlin, Germany, offering paid email accounts for individuals and businesses.

name: Proton Mail
description: Proton Mail (previously written as ProtonMail) is a Swiss end-to-end encrypted email service founded in 2013 headquartered in Plan-les-Ouates, Switzerland.

name: Proximus Group
description: The Proximus Group is a provider of digital services and communication in Belgium and the international markets.

name: Rambler (portal)
description: Rambler (Russian: Рамблер) is a Russian search engine and one of the biggest Russian web portals, owned by the Rambler Media Group.

name: Rediff.com
description: Rediff.com, stylized as rediff.com, is an Indian news, information, entertainment and shopping web portal.

name: Seznam
description: Seznam is a Czech internet search engine and web portal offering various online services like email, news, and maps.

name: SFR
description: SFR (French: [ɛsɛfɛʁ]; in full: Société française du radiotéléphone [sɔsjete fʁɑ̃sɛːz dy ʁadjotelefɔn]) is a French telecommunications company.

name: Shaw Communications
description: Shaw Communications Inc.

name: Skiff (email service)
description: Skiff is an end-to-end encrypted email service and collaboration tool.

name: Swisscom
description: Swisscom AG is a major telecommunications provider in Switzerland.

name: T-Online
description: t-online.de is a German news portal, owned and published by digital multi-channel media company Ströer.

name: Telecom Italia Mobile
description: Telecom Italia Mobile S.p.A., commonly known as TIM, is an Italian telecommunications company owned by Telecom Italia S.p.A. Founded as a mobile telephony company in 1995, since 2015 it provides mobile, fixed telephony, and Internet services.4G is available in 6,849 cities (96.3% of the country).

name: Telenet
description: Telenet was an American commercial packet-switched network which went into service in 1975.

name: Telia
description: Telia Company AB is a Swedish multinational telecommunications company and mobile network operator present in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania.

name: Telstra
description: Telstra Group Limited is an Australian telecommunications company that builds and operates telecommunications networks and markets related products and services.

name: Tencent
description: Tencent Holdings Ltd.

name: Terra (company)
description: Terra is a Spanish Internet multinational company owned by Telefónica, with headquarters in Spain and offices in Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico, the United States and Peru.

name: Tessellis
description: Tessellis S.p.A. (formerly Tiscali S.p.A.) is an Italian telecommunications company founded in 1998 and based in Cagliari, Sardinia, that provides Internet and telecommunications services in Italy, and, previously had operations in other European nations through its acquisition of many smaller European Internet Service Providers (ISPs) in the late 1990s.

name: Tutanota
description: Tutanota is an end-to-end encrypted email app and a freemium secure email service.

name: UKR
description: Ukr.net is one of the most popular news internet services in Ukraine.

name: United Internet
description: United Internet AG is a global Internet services company headquartered in Montabaur, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany.

name: Universo Online
description: Universo Online (Portuguese for "Online Universe") (known by the acronym UOL) is a Brazilian web content, products and services company.

name: Virgilio.it
description: Virgilio was the first web portal in Italy.

name: Virgin Media
description: Virgin Media is a British telecommunications company, founded in 2007, which provides telephone, television and internet services in the United Kingdom.

name: VK (company)
description: VK, known as Mail.ru Group until 12 October 2021, is a Russian technology company.

name: Vodafone
description: Vodafone Group plc () is a British multinational telecommunications company.

name: Wirtualna Polska
description: Wirtualna Polska is a leading Polish online media and e-commerce platform offering news, entertainment, and various digital services.

name: Xfinity
description: Comcast Cable Communications, LLC, doing business as Xfinity, is an American telecommunications business segment and division of Comcast Corporation used to market consumer cable television, internet, telephone, and wireless services provided by the company.

name: Yahoo! Mail
description: Yahoo!

name: Yandex Mail
description: Yandex Mail (Russian: Яндекс Почта, tr.

name: Ziggo
description: Ziggo Holding B.V. (Dutch pronunciation: [zɪɣ(ː)oː]) is the largest cable operator in the Netherlands, providing digital cable television, Internet, and telephone service to both residential and commercial customers.

name: Zoho Corporation
description: Zoho Corporation, is an Indian multinational technology company that makes computer software and web-based business tools.
